column1: Pericardial fluid Gram stain is a method of staining a sample of fluid taken from the sac surrounding the heart to diagnose a bacterial infection.
The Gram stain method is one of the most commonly used techniques for the rapid diagnosis of bacterial infections.
Your doctor may order this test if you have signs of a heart infection or a pericardial effusion (fluid buildup) with an unknown cause.
If bacteria are present, you may have an infection of the pericardium or heart.
